intro: Ghinia raphanifolia, commonly known as the radish leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are often lobed and covered in a fine layer of white to grayish hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
